name: Titanium.UI.Animation
summary: The Animation object defines an animation that can be applied to a view.

properties.name: anchorPoint
properties.summary: Coordinate of the view about which to pivot an animation.
properties.description:
Used on Android only. For iOS, use anchorPoint.

Anchor point is specified as a fraction of the view's size. For example, {0, 0} is at the view's top-left corner, {0.5, 0.5} at its center and {1, 1} at its bottom-right corner.

This property's value will overwrite the anchorPoint used in the matrix's creation dictionary.

See the "Using an anchorPoint" example for a demonstration.

properties.name: autoreverse
properties.summary: Specifies if the animation should be replayed in reverse upon completion.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.summary: Value of the backgroundColor property at the end of the animation, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: bottom
properties.summary: Value of the bottom property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: center
properties.summary: Value of the center property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: color
properties.summary: Value of the color property at the end of the animation, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: curve
properties.summary: Animation curve or easing function to apply to the animation.

properties.name: dampingRatio
properties.summary: The damping ratio for the spring animation as it approaches its quiescent state.
properties.description: Use a value between 0 and 1. For a smoother deceleration use values closer to 1. To increase oscillation use value closer to 0.

properties.name: delay
properties.summary: Delay, in milliseconds before starting the animation.

properties.name: duration
properties.summary: Duration of the animation, in milliseconds.

properties.name: elevation
properties.summary: Value of the elevation property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: height
properties.summary: Value of the height property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: left
properties.summary: Value of the left property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: opacity
properties.summary: Value of the opacity property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: opaque
properties.summary: Value of the opaque property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: repeat
properties.summary: Number of times the animation should be performed.
properties.description: If autoreverse is true, then one repeat of the animation consists of the animation being played once forward, and once backward.

properties.name: right
properties.summary: Value of the right property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: springVelocity
properties.summary: The initial spring velocity.
properties.description: For smooth start to the animation, match this value to the velocity of view as it was prior to attachment. A value of 1 corresponds to the total animation distance traversed in one second. For example, if the total animation distance is 200 points and you want the start of the animation to match a view velocity of 100 pt/s, use a value of 0.5.

properties.name: top
properties.summary: Value of the top property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: transform
properties.summary: Animate the view from its current tranform to the specified transform.
properties.description:
Over the course of the animation, the view interpolates from its current transform to the specified transform.

3D transforms are only supported on iOS.

properties.name: transition
properties.summary: Transition type to use during a transition animation.
properties.description: The new view being transitioned to should NOT be a child of another view or of the animating view. The animation replaces the current view from the view heirarchy and adds the new view to it.

properties.name: view
properties.summary: New view to transition to.
properties.description:
Specify the transition property with one of the transition style constants defined in Titanium.UI.iOS.AnimationStyle to select the effect to apply.

The new view being transitioned to should NOT be a child of another view or of the animating view. The animation replaces the current view from the view heirarchy and adds the new view to it.

properties.name: visible
properties.summary: Value of the visible property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: width
properties.summary: Value of the width property at the end of the animation.

properties.name: zIndex
properties.summary: Value of the zIndex property at the end of the animation.
properties.description: Refer to zIndex for an explanation of z-index.
